title: Every time I restart my phone it asks for an permission to send messages
content:
Recently upgraded to Android 9 security patch dated May 5 and started getting several requests of "[insert random name here] would like to send a message to 45567"  from the following so far: 

Com.android.sdm.plugin 
Connectivity manager 
Oemdmtrigger
com.qualcomm.data

Is something broken with the latest update on my phone?

On Freedom mobile too.

Update (I can't seem to reply to my own post): I've sent a Twitter message to freedom. Will keep this thread advised.

Edit: it seems like disabling visual voicemail  solved the problem by hiding it for now and it will do while waiting for Freedom to fix the issue, i guess.
